title: Use the point-slope form for the equation of a line.
text: The point-slope form for the equation of a line is $$y-y1=m \left(x-x1\right)$$, We can plug in what we know, which is $$m=\frac{-1}{13}$$, $$x1=-8$$, $$y1=2$$, to solve for the equation.
